story:
(Above, left to right: Clever Horse, Smart Horse, Timid Horse, Apple Horse, Speedy Horse, Party Horse, Fashion Horse)

To anybody doing an odd combinations of perks, see the $1 perk for instructions. A pledge manager is on its way; expect an email within a few days.


Tiny Equine Stockings!

Your chance to get your own Tiny Equine socks has arrived. Order a few for yourself to prance around in, or order the Friendship Pack to share with those special somehorses in your life!


PLEASE ADD $5 SHIPPING FOR CONTINENTAL USA, and $15 FOR ALL INTERNATIONAL PER ORDER

Gallery is here: http://imgur.com/a/rDvZX


The Socks:

The socks themselves are made of high-quality material that's particularly stretchy and maintains its color well even when stretched. They are all the same size, and can fit, bare minimum, a men's shoe size 12, as pictured here:



The Goal:

The funding goal is the first step in mass-producing these; at 100, 300, 500, and 750 pairs of each design, the price of production per pair drops. With this drop in the cost of production, we can turn those savings right around into new designs to be added to the top-tier perks, or available separately for the same price as the others.


Funding

  • When full funding is reached, the first stretch goal will become available as an additional purchasable perk, as well as a free addition to everybody who orders the Sock Buddies perk or higher. Afterwards, new stretch goals will be announced as each previous goal is met, and each new design will be added FREE OF CHARGE to Friendship Pack supporters.

  • Please spread the campaign as much as possible! More funding means more stretch goals, which means more socks for everyhorse! Use the tools on the top of the page, or simply share the URL wherever you've got friends.


Risks & Challenges

If the campaign isn't fully funded, it won't happen at all. That's why it's so important we reach our goal. If the campaign is fully funded, Stretch Goals and Addons will become available. With the addition of these additional designs, the production time will increase slightly, possibly causing delays in delivery, but ultimately providing a better product.


STRETCH GOALS

  • FULL FUNDING: The Clever Horse design, the  socks pictured below, will be added for no additional charge to everybody who purchases the Sock Buddies or Friend Pack perks.


  • 2X FUNDING: The Sun Horse and Moon Horse designs (concept below) will become available, and will be added to any Friend Pack order free of charge.



  • FURTHER STRETCH GOALS: To be announced!


Gallery:

story:
the idea of digems

digems (digital gems) means for us to change your piece of jewellery any time onto your mood and your outfit. 

Wear what you want -  your colours, your style - your digems 
Wear it on a chain, pocket watch or charm etc... and explore the possibility of digital jewellery

digems kitWith the mounting mechanism digems kit2 the apple watch goes straight from the wrist onto a chain around the neck. 

Features

Assemble like this 


History

– 2012 –

we start the idea of user generated jewellery

– end of 2012 –

 digems kit1 for iPod nano 6G starts
now there is a second live for the nano 6G 

– 2013 –

our Down & Upload area for free design sharing starts
*the idea of user generated jewellery is completed*



– 2015 –

introducing digems kit2 for apple watch


Next steps

– June 2015 –

final fitting
(once we have our apple watch)

manufacturing
kit2´s production and packaging relies on quality and sustainability 
"made in germany"

– from august –

shipping starts
each digems kit2 is tested on an apple watch before it is shipped


Perks

digems kit1 for the Ipod nano 6G [more information about digems kit1]

digems kit2 for the apple watch "anodized aluminum" black

digems kit2 for the apple watch "anodized aluminum" silver



one more thing:

Download the designs you love for free

digems.com offers you the chance to download iPod nano designs free of charge from the Upload/Download Area at  Upload/Download Area.

All designs for both apple watches are available free of charge 
once we begin with the dispatch of the"digems kit2"

Go to this Area and browse through the designs. Enjoy!


About us

Hi my name is Andreas and i am a designer and artist from Munich. 
I developed the idea of digems with my friend Martin, a Berlin based technician and designer. We have met in 2003 at the art university in Berlin. Martin worked there as a technical lecturer and since then we are working together on various innovative projects. 

We hope you like the idea of wearing user generated jewellery and if you have any questions, please contact us at question@digems.com 

Thanks for supporting us.


If you are interested in my lastest fashion project:
me-had

story:
Overview

A line of leather jackets in 2 styles for both men and women.

  • Double Riders (*Perfecto type)
  • Single Riders (*Speedway type).

Each style has the same features!

  • Water-repellent finish
  • Stain resistant finish
  • Wind resistant finish
  • High durability and comfort
  • A place for almost everything in 3 zipped pockets and 1 inside pocket.

(The double riders also gets a coin pocket secured with a flap and snap button.)

One other thing; we are a small company without large resources, this project is made possible because of our close relationship with our factory and suppliers. We haven't wasted any resources on expensive ad campaigns and promotional videos. Everything was shot by us using the actual products that we guarantee to deliver to our backers.

A New Era for Leather

It all began with a simple idea.

"Wouldn't it be great if leather could be resistant to effects of water exposure and stains!"

We took this idea to our production partner and over the course of the next year and, after many trials and errors, (Its never easy developing something new and innovative) we created this revolutionary water repellent finish.

 
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

WATER REPELLENT

We made them water repellent so you wouldn't have to worry if you are caught in an unexpected shower.

STAIN RESISTANT

We know spills can happen, especially after a few rounds, that's why we also made them stain resistant. Coffee, beer, wine, soda, cocktails your jacket will ride away stain free.

NATURAL STRETCH

Our soft and durable lamb leather jackets have a natural stretch that allows for ease of movement and comfort. Whether your out touring on your favourite bike (be it a Harley, a Honda, a Vespa or even a Pashley!) or just strolling around town you know you'll not only look great but also safe in the knowledge that you're also protected from any unexpected changes in the weather.

 

The Leather

*Soft, durable and stretchable napa lamb leather.

Synthetic materials don’t get better with age…in fact they don’t age at all. Leather on the other hand, especially our full grain aniline dyed lamb leather, has the unique quality in that the more it ages the more character it has. Our jackets will develop a patina with age. Making the jacket more beautiful with time, without losing its shape or colour.

So, the love and care you give your jacket is rewarded by the fact that it will only get better the more you give!

It was important to us that we use the highest quality Napa lamb leather for this revolutionary line up. Working closely with our partner factory, we selected the most suitable Napa lamb leather available.

*We only use ethically & sustainably sourced leather from local Pakistani farmers. The animals are all grass fed and the leather is a bi product, meaning the animal is #NotFarmedForFashion. We do this to give support to the local economy in the fullest possible way, helping provide the local population with food, enhancing crop production, generating cash income, providing year-round employment, spreading risk and providing fuel and transport and in some small way helping shape the future of the fashion industry.

 

Treatment & Production

Made to Last

The common perception of leather is that it is sensitive to moisture. However, it doesn’t have to be this way. After much testing we have added a revolutionary stain and water repellent treatment during the dying process, utilising Stahl Neo®& Densodrin® range of products for sustainable tanning & high-performance water-repellency to ensure the long-lasting durability of the Jackets. This leaves the jackets immaculate even when exposed to water.

*We chose Stahl as our leather solutions partner because of their commitment to the environment and strive to make leather production as ethical and environmentally friendly as possible.

As soon as we receive the skins, we send them directly to Stahl so they can go about turning them into the beautiful leather required for this project. Some time later, the dry leathers are sent to the cutting table where they are cut by hand into the 2 different styles. Both styles contain a lot of individual parts so this can take a while. When the leather is cut, it is passed to our tailors. They work with each piece separately, and this is the part of the process where the jacket starts to take shape. The skilled tailors add the original printed lining together with all trims, including buttons and zippers.

After weeks of hard work, love and dedication in the production process, the jacket is perfected and ready to be shipped.

 

What We Need & What You Get

*1920's era Kyoto town house "Kyo-machi-ya" 

We are looking to raise raise ¥6,000,000 (US$58,000). We would like to use the bulk of this (After costs) to renovate the ground floor of our "Machiya townhouse" office into London Denims first physical stand alone store. 

For this campaign we set out to challenge the established pricing model of today, where traditional luxury brands mark-up their prices in some cases up to 800%. Their business model includes distributors, agents, high-street retail locations and excessive marketing. As all these middlemen need their margin, the apparel ends up overpriced and silly expensive. We decided to challenge that model. By teaming up directly with our manufacturers, cutting out the middlemen and selling our products directly to you, we can now offer these premium quality jackets at factory direct prices. 

Super Early Bird @ 50% off RRP (limited to 40), Early Bird @ 40% off RRP, (limited to 60) Better late than never @ 30% off RRP. Any 2 Super Early Birds Jackets @ 55% off RRP (limited to 10), Any 2 Early Bird Jackets @ 45% off RRP (limited to 20) and Any 2 Better late than never deals @ 35% off RRP (limited to 30)

 

 

Even if we do not reach our intended goal all funds raised, minus the costs of course, will still be used towards the ongoing restoration of our "Machiya townhouse".

 

Free Garment Bag

 

*1 complimentary original London Denim garment bag (Black) with every jacket.

 

The Test!

*We tested to see if the jackets were resistance to effects of water exposure by pooling an equal amount of water in 2 jackets. The jacket on the left (Blue) has been treated with our revolutionary water-repellency finish and the one on the right (grey) is untreated leather. The test was conducted over a 6 hour period and as you can see the treated jacket shows no signs of being affected by water in any way, no water soaked into the leather or seeped through to the lining. Unfortunately the same could not be said for the untreated leather, which soaked up all the water, transferring it to the lining.

​*Even after 24 hours the treated jacket still showed no signs of being affected by the water. No water soaked into the leather or seeped through to the lining.

 

The Impact

For this project we are using only Top Grain Lamb Leather that has been finished with our revolutionary water-repellency finish. (This took nearly 1 year to perfect. The leather is treated during the tanning / dying process and again as a final treatment as garments.)

We only use ethically & sustainably sourced leather from local Pakistani farmers. The animals are all grass fed and the leather is a bi product, meaning the animal is #NotFarmedForFashion. We do this to give support to the local economy in the fullest possible way, helping provide the local population with food, enhancing crop production, generating cash income, providing year-round employment, spreading risk and providing fuel and transport and in some small way helping shape the future of the fashion industry.

 

Our Factory

PAKISTAN is considered to be the hub of producing high quality Leather and Leather Products. Pakistan is rich in agricultural products and environment. The large livestock population plays an important role in the economy of Pakistan.

Some time later, the dry leathers are sent to the cutting table where they are cut by hand into the 2 different styles.

The careful selection of leather is the key to a quality product. If you use the wrinkled parts at the edge of the material the cost will decrease, but so will the quality of the product.

When the leather is cut, it is passed to our tailors. They work with each piece separately, and this is the part of the process where the jacket starts to take shape. The skilled tailors add the original printed lining together with all trims, including buttons and zippers.​

 

Project Details

Many Leather products sold today often show both "sheep leather" and "lamb leather" as lamb leather, however we guarantee this product uses only carefully selected sustainable lamb leather. No leather made for clothing has ever been truly water-resistant. (The leather material used for bags and shoes, etc. is hard, so it can be waterproofed.) In addition, although there are light water repellent processes for leather used in clothing, eventually the water will soak through to the back side, all too often leaving unpleasant water marks and stains. Above all, the appeal of this product is that it is completely water-resistant, while having the softness and stretchability that are characteristic of high quality lamb leather. (Stretchability also works well for motorcycle touring.) In addition, timeless styling makes it simple to coordinate either of these jackets for any social occasion whilst having the reassurance that no matter what the weather brings your full grain lamb leather jacket will keep you safe and dry, and just as importantly protect itself in the process! 

 

The jackets in the real world!

 

She wears Double Riders Ladies Size I (S) 

He wears Single Riders Mens Size II (M) 

He wears Single Riders Mens Size I (S) 

She wears Double Riders ladies Size I (S)      He wears Double Riders Mens Size II (M) 

She wears Double Riders ladies Size I (S)     He wears Double Riders Mens Size II (M)

 

He wears Double Riders Mens Size II (M)

She wears Single Riders ladies Size I (S)         He wears Single Riders Mens Size II (M)

She wears Double Single ladies Size I (S)             

 He wears Single Riders Mens Size II (M)

Details : Embossed Logo on back (Optional)

Details : Waist belt and buckle, coin or key pocket with flap & side pocket with zip.

Details: Coller with stand, Action pleats for comfort & Cuff with zip closure.

Details:Front zip & Breast pocket, Side adjuster & side pocket, Inside pocket.

She wears Double Single ladies Size I (S)    

He wears Single Riders Mens Size III (L)

He wears Single Riders Mens Size III (L)

He wears Double Riders Mens Size II (M)

He wears Double Riders Mens Size II (M)

He wears Double Riders Mens Size II (M)

He wears Double Riders Mens Size II (M)

He wears Single Riders Mens Size II (M)

He wears Single Riders Mens Size II (M)

 

*Sizing in CM

*Sizing in CM

 

Short Summary

London Denim is a luxury streetwear brand. Launched in London in 2001 by then founder Simon King. London Denim was the first denim label to show at London Fashion week, in 2001, paving the way for other streetwear brands to follow. In 2004 Peter Card introduced the brand to Japan, under license, and has grown the brand steadily since.

In 2019 Peter took over control of the brand from Simon and he now runs the brands day to day operations from his “Machiya” townhouse office in central Kyoto.

Peter says "The reasons behind the crowdfund campaign are to further raise brand awareness and also to raise funds to help convert part of the “Machiya townhouse” Office into the brands 1st physical shop and cafe."

 

Risks & Challenges

We have already overcome all the major challenges, having successfully developed and tested the revolutionary water repellancy process. All that is left is to make and deliver these beautiful jackets to our backers.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We totally understand that not everyone is able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

No action is too small. We would greatly appreciate your help in spreading the word about this  product. Please kindly share on SNS and speak to people close to you! Shout it out from the rooftops! and if nothing else grabs you use the share tools here on Indiegogo!

And that's all there is to it.

"Wouldn't it be great if leather could be resistant to effects of water exposure and stains!" 
We took this idea to our production partner and over the course of the next year and, after many trials and errors, (Its never easy developing something new and innovative) we created this revolutionary water repellent finish.

 
 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 

WATER REPELLENT

We made them water repellent so you wouldn't have to worry if you are caught in an unexpected shower.

STAIN RESISTANT

We know spills can happen, especially after a few rounds, that's why we also made them stain resistant. Coffee, beer, wine, soda, cocktails your jacket will ride away stain free.

NATURAL STRETCH
Our soft and durable lamb leather jackets have a natural stretch that allows for ease of movement and comfort. Whether your out touring on your favourite bike (be it a Harley, a Honda, a Vespa or even a Pashley!) or just strolling around town you know you'll not only look great but also safe in the knowledge that you're also protected from any unexpected changes in the weather.
 

The Leather

*Soft, durable and stretchable napa lamb leather.
Synthetic materials don’t get better with age…in fact they don’t age at all. Leather on the other hand, especially our full grain aniline dyed lamb leather, has the unique quality in that the more it ages the more character it has. Our jackets will develop a patina with age. Making the jacket more beautiful with time, without losing its shape or colour.
So, the love and care you give your jacket is rewarded by the fact that it will only get better the more you give!
It was important to us that we use the highest quality Napa lamb leather for this revolutionary line up. Working closely with our partner factory, we selected the most suitable Napa lamb leather available.
*We only use ethically & sustainably sourced leather from local Pakistani farmers. The animals are all grass fed and the leather is a bi product, meaning the animal is #NotFarmedForFashion. We do this to give support to the local economy in the fullest possible way, helping provide the local population with food, enhancing crop production, generating cash income, providing year-round employment, spreading risk and providing fuel and transport and in some small way helping shape the future of the fashion industry.
 
Treatment & Production

Made to Last
The common perception of leather is that it is sensitive to moisture. However, it doesn’t have to be this way. After much testing we have added a revolutionary stain and water repellent treatment during the dying process, utilising Stahl Neo®& Densodrin® range of products for sustainable tanning & high-performance water-repellency to ensure the long-lasting durability of the Jackets. This leaves the jackets immaculate even when exposed to water.
*We chose Stahl as our leather solutions partner because of their commitment to the environment and strive to make leather production as ethical and environmentally friendly as possible.
As soon as we receive the skins, we send them directly to Stahl so they can go about turning them into the beautiful leather required for this project. Some time later, the dry leathers are sent to the cutting table where they are cut by hand into the 2 different styles. Both styles contain a lot of individual parts so this can take a while. When the leather is cut, it is passed to our tailors. They work with each piece separately, and this is the part of the process where the jacket starts to take shape. The skilled tailors add the original printed lining together with all trims, including buttons and zippers.
After weeks of hard work, love and dedication in the production process, the jacket is perfected and ready to be shipped.
 

What We Need & What You Get

*1920's era Kyoto town house "Kyo-machi-ya" 
We are looking to raise raise ¥6,000,000 (US$58,000). We would like to use the bulk of this (After costs) to renovate the ground floor of our "Machiya townhouse" office into London Denims first physical stand alone store. 
For this campaign we set out to challenge the established pricing model of today, where traditional luxury brands mark-up their prices in some cases up to 800%. Their business model includes distributors, agents, high-street retail locations and excessive marketing. As all these middlemen need their margin, the apparel ends up overpriced and silly expensive. We decided to challenge that model. By teaming up directly with our manufacturers, cutting out the middlemen and selling our products directly to you, we can now offer these premium quality jackets at factory direct prices. 
Super Early Bird @ 50% off RRP (limited to 40), Early Bird @ 40% off RRP, (limited to 60) Better late than never @ 30% off RRP. Any 2 Super Early Birds Jackets @ 55% off RRP (limited to 10), Any 2 Early Bird Jackets @ 45% off RRP (limited to 20) and Any 2 Better late than never deals @ 35% off RRP (limited to 30)
 

 
Even if we do not reach our intended goal all funds raised, minus the costs of course, will still be used towards the ongoing restoration of our "Machiya townhouse".
 
Free Garment Bag
 

*1 complimentary original London Denim garment bag (Black) with every jacket.
 

The Test!

*We tested to see if the jackets were resistance to effects of water exposure by pooling an equal amount of water in 2 jackets. The jacket on the left (Blue) has been treated with our revolutionary water-repellency finish and the one on the right (grey) is untreated leather. The test was conducted over a 6 hour period and as you can see the treated jacket shows no signs of being affected by water in any way, no water soaked into the leather or seeped through to the lining. Unfortunately the same could not be said for the untreated leather, which soaked up all the water, transferring it to the lining.
​*Even after 24 hours the treated jacket still showed no signs of being affected by the water. No water soaked into the leather or seeped through to the lining. The Impact
For this project we are using only Top Grain Lamb Leather that has been finished with our revolutionary water-repellency finish. (This took nearly 1 year to perfect. The leather is treated during the tanning / dying process and again as a final treatment as garments.)
We only use ethically & sustainably sourced leather from local Pakistani farmers. The animals are all grass fed and the leather is a bi product, meaning the animal is #NotFarmedForFashion. We do this to give support to the local economy in the fullest possible way, helping provide the local population with food, enhancing crop production, generating cash income, providing year-round employment, spreading risk and providing fuel and transport and in some small way helping shape the future of the fashion industry.
 
Our Factory
PAKISTAN is considered to be the hub of producing high quality Leather and Leather Products. Pakistan is rich in agricultural products and environment. The large livestock population plays an important role in the economy of Pakistan.

Some time later, the dry leathers are sent to the cutting table where they are cut by hand into the 2 different styles.

The careful selection of leather is the key to a quality product. If you use the wrinkled parts at the edge of the material the cost will decrease, but so will the quality of the product.

When the leather is cut, it is passed to our tailors. They work with each piece separately, and this is the part of the process where the jacket starts to take shape. The skilled tailors add the original printed lining together with all trims, including buttons and zippers.​


 
Project Details
Many Leather products sold today often show both "sheep leather" and "lamb leather" as lamb leather, however we guarantee this product uses only carefully selected sustainable lamb leather. No leather made for clothing has ever been truly water-resistant. (The leather material used for bags and shoes, etc. is hard, so it can be waterproofed.) In addition, although there are light water repellent processes for leather used in clothing, eventually the water will soak through to the back side, all too often leaving unpleasant water marks and stains. Above all, the appeal of this product is that it is completely water-resistant, while having the softness and stretchability that are characteristic of high quality lamb leather. (Stretchability also works well for motorcycle touring.) In addition, timeless styling makes it simple to coordinate either of these jackets for any social occasion whilst having the reassurance that no matter what the weather brings your full grain lamb leather jacket will keep you safe and dry, and just as importantly protect itself in the process! 
 
The jackets in the real world!
 

She wears Double Riders Ladies Size I (S) 

He wears Single Riders Mens Size II (M) 

He wears Single Riders Mens Size I (S) 

She wears Double Riders ladies Size I (S)      He wears Double Riders Mens Size II (M)

*Sizing in CM

*Sizing in CM
 
Short Summary
London Denim is a luxury streetwear brand. Launched in London in 2001 by then founder Simon King. London Denim was the first denim label to show at London Fashion week, in 2001, paving the way for other streetwear brands to follow. In 2004 Peter Card introduced the brand to Japan, under license, and has grown the brand steadily since.
In 2019 Peter took over control of the brand from Simon and he now runs the brands day to day operations from his “Machiya” townhouse office in central Kyoto.
Peter says "The reasons behind the crowdfund campaign are to further raise brand awareness and also to raise funds to help convert part of the “Machiya townhouse” Office into the brands 1st physical shop and cafe."
 

Risks & Challenges
We have already overcome all the major challenges, having successfully developed and tested the revolutionary water repellancy process. All that is left is to make and deliver these beautiful jackets to our backers.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
We totally understand that not everyone is able to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:
No action is too small. We would greatly appreciate your help in spreading the word about this  product. Please kindly share on SNS and speak to people close to you! Shout it out from the rooftops! and if nothing else grabs you use the share tools here on Indiegogo!
And that's all there is to it.

story:
Greetings,

My name is Amber Green,  I am a 23 year old female from Atlanta Georgia.

I came up with a product that efficiently preserves the straight hairstyle while creating a healthier way to set hair during down time.

For use, simply twist side brushes to extract bristles, place on head, twist clockwise or counter clockwise until hair is completely in cap, and retract bristles for comfort.

The Wrap Cap puts a unique twist to the night wear industry because it does the job of at least four different hair appliances and none of my competition has the ability to wrap hair without the help of other appliances.

The hair industry is a billion dollar industry that continues to grow, my product has the ability to persevere the straight hairstyle for a longer period of time, saving time, money and energy.  

My invention relates generally to cap, and more specifically, to a cap fitted to the head with brush bristles inside the cap which brushes hair into a circular wrap style as the cap is twisted clockwise or counter clockwise. The brushes I have on my latest prototype are round, plastic, 3 inches in diameter with retractable bristles for comfort for the wearer.  The cap material is made out of stretch satin with an elastic band around the opening for a better fit to the head. This product is patented technology.

Individuals have been using the wrap method to preserve the straight hair style for years. The problem lies in that, many people don’t know how to wrap their hair using regular brushes and pins or simply are too lazy after a hard days’ work.  My product is a major improvement of the already known wrap methods. Imagine saving time when ever you need to preserve your straight hair style during down time like working out or sleeping. Imagine saving money by maintaining that fresh blow out for days longer. Imagine saving energy by skipping that step of straightening  your hair before going out.  If my goal is reached, the funds I am seeking will go to perfecting my latest prototype, starting my marketing campaign and receiving my first batch of inventory.

story:
Dreamland Baby is a premier line of Weighted Sleep Sacks designed to naturally reduce stress and increase relaxation through deep touch stimulation.  

The gentle weight increases serotonin and melatonin while decreasing cortisol. Helping babies feel calm, fall asleep faster and stay asleep longer.

Clinically proven to significantly increase calm feelings and improve sleep patterns in a study that investigated newborns and weighted blankets. 

Nearly half of all new parents get just 1 - 3 hours of uninterrupted sleep per night. Dreamland Baby can help change that... 

A well rested baby is a happy baby.... 

Dreamland Baby's wearable weighted blankets are designed in partnership with pediatricians, NICU nurses and certified sleep consults.

Dreamland Baby is Safety Certified, has exceeded all United States Consumer Product Safety Commission standards,  and is recognized by the International Hip Dysplasia Institute as a hip-healthy product. 

A parent’s hug is scientifically proven to soothe. Dreamland Baby's gentle weight mimics this touch leading to improved mood, relaxation and ultimately sleep. 

Many Neonatal Intensive Care Units (NICUs) use weighted components to calm babies and promote deep, restful sleep. The gentle weight provides near-instant comfort and relief. 

Weighted blankets have been used for adults and children for many years. Infants now have the opportunity to safely get the same incredible sleep and relaxation through Dreamland Baby's wearable weighted blankets. 

At almost six months old, our son Luke was still waking up every hour and a half.  Like so many other new parents we were desperate for sleep. One night we placed him under a heavy throw blanket while sitting on our couch. I noticed a calm immediately came over his face. A lightbulb went off in my head: he needs a weighted blanket! I called my mother-in-law to sew my idea; a lightly weighted sleep sack. The first night wearing our prototype Luke slept 12 hours! We couldn’t believe how immediately his sleep was improved. Word quickly spread and I was flooded with requests from family and friends.  The idea to bring Dreamland Baby to families everywhere was born.

 

We set out to create a swaddle that keeps baby’s arms secure and is convenient for parents. The ingenious removable wing allows baby to stay snug while you wash the wing or completely remove it if baby rolls over before six months.

 

Our products are expertly crafted for the highest quality, made of 100% soft, natural cotton.  From beautiful, instagram-worthy design to thoughtful materials sourcing, we set out to design a product that looks and feels as great as it performs.

At just 10% or less of your baby's body weight, Dreamland Baby's gentle weight helps calm your baby by simulating the feeling of being held and hugged. 

The even distribution of weight, covering your baby's entire body, sets us apart from anything else on the market. Dreamland Baby is the world's FIRST wearable weighted blanket!

There is another company that makes a sleep product with a weighted component on the chest, only.  We ordered this product and for us, it did not work. My son likes to be hugged and feel a gentle pressure on his entire body. He wanted a wearable weighted blanket. 

Dreamland's weighted filling is a High Density Plastic Poly Pellet (think Beanie Babies™). The material is odorless, non-toxic, and food grade, completely safe! The rounded beads are evenly distributed in hand-sewn 1'' boxes to provide a gentle weight and comfortable texture. 

There are two YKK zippers. One at the top and one at the bottom for those middle of the night diaper changes.

August 2018: Idea conceived - Luke sleeps 12 hours! 

August- December 2018: design + prototype development 

January- March 2019: prototype testing 

April 2019: quality + safety testing of samples 

May-June: Run Kickstarter 

June: Kickstarter complete & Production begins 

July Production complete & final quality = safety certification 

July-August: Product ships

August: Rewards delivered to YOU! 

Why Crowdfuning?

Our trusted manufacturing partners need a minimum financial commitment to produce a large manufacturing run. This is why we have set our funding goal to $12,500. By hitting this funding goal, we are able to meet the factory minimum order and bring Dreamland to you, your baby and your whole family!

 

Risks and challenges

We are a team of designers, operation and manufacturing specialists, clinical experts and like you, moms. We understand what goes into designing a premier product that babies and moms will love. 
Our manufacturing partners are ready to go. We are using a trusted factory that also produces for Disney. We have already produced a sample run – to ensure quality, safety and performance. A number of lucky family and friends have already received Dreamland and are currently enjoying a full night's sleep. 
Based on our experience, we anticipate being able to fulfill orders around 8 weeks after the Kickstarter concludes.

Risks and challenges
We are a team of designers, operation and manufacturing specialists, clinical experts and like you, moms. We understand what goes into designing a premier product that babies and moms will love. Our manufacturing partners are ready to go. We are using a trusted factory that also produces for Disney. We have already produced a sample run – to ensure quality, safety and performance. A number of lucky family and friends have already received Dreamland and are currently enjoying a full night's sleep. Based on our experience, we anticipate being able to fulfill orders around 8 weeks after the Kickstarter concludes.

story:
Introducing VIG

We designed VIG wallet with active people in mind. The dimensions of VIG are reduced to occupy minimal space while offering functional and resistant features.

We are obsessed with perfecting this design, to make a unique product for the unique lives of our customers. We also want to ensure the production of VIG is environmentally conscious, so both main components are 100% recyclable materials.

VIG can hold up to 10 credit cards plus bank notes... with style.

The collection we offer for this campaign consists of Indigo, Roig, Noir, Lola, Fiesta and Toro:

                 

                

               

VIG is made of different materials 

    

Overview


VIG is a tri-fold polypropylene wallet with a large textile band.

With your VIG you can hold multiple cards and bank notes, depending on your needs:

  • Inside: holds up to 7 cards or 5 cards and 4 bank notes*

  • Outside: holds up to 3 cards or 5 bank notes*

(* bank notes total capacity will depend on the currency)

The VIG is made of two components that are 100% recyclable:

  • Body: polypropylene resin, identification code nº5 

  • Band: elastic textile, sewed and stitched

Project Status

After 11 months of intense work, designing and testing Vig prototypes, we're satisfied that the design is complete. Now we're ready to begin production.

All of our stakeholders have participated actively in the process. We designed Vig wallet by iterations, collecting feedback from users, and using that feedback to improve each prototype until we had it right. Lean Startup Methodology has been our principal guideline in this process. 

Pictured below there are the last prototype version:


We will continue releasing new Vig color combinations. And these will be made available as we reach our financial goals.

For the first run, we'll limit manufacturing to 5 models (Indiegogo Collection) from our Vig collection. This is a strategic decision to reduce risk of overextending our investment capital. If we exceed our funding goals, we will consider including more models of our collection in the first production run:

We want the maximum benefit from the production phase and to, of course, achieve the best results. For this reason our proposal is to produce Vig wallets in Europe and U.S. This means the production costs will be slightly higher, but this arrangement will allow us better control of the production process and ease of intervention in case of production issues.

We understand that people don't want to sacrifice quality for price, and price is a vital aspect of the product's success today's market. Users deserve products that are durable, functional and affordable. We want to meet these expectations and to do so we need two main things: 

  •  A minimum of 560 orders or 1195 wallets 
  •  The steel mold necessary for plastic injection (polypropylene)

            

The steel mold is the most expensive part of this investment and drives the bulk of our pledge request. Your investment will finance the production of the Vig wallet mold and plastic injection, to allow delivery of the finial product to our users.  

Production Plan

We have everything ready to start the production. We have compared different suppliers of industrial molds and plastic injectors. We  have also planned deadlines and following up meetings for the production. 

Communication process: we understand the importance of communication to our backers, we will provide continuous updates during the evolution of production. 

The production schedule is divided in 16 weeks , from receiving funds to final product shippment to our backers. Have a look below on our detailed activity plan:

Communication process (defined)
Website (done)
Social media (done)

Supply chain 
Study different mold manufactures (done)
Study different strap suppliers (done)
Mold manufacturer supplier selection (done)
Plastic injector selection (done,price,terms and conditions agreed)
Mold manufacturer negotiations (done, guaranteed lead-time of 2 months, price,terms and conditions agreed) 
Straps selections (done) 
Packaging choice (in progress) 
Packaging print/wording selection (done) 
Packaging supply guaranteed (lead-time of 4 weeks) 

Manufacturing 
3D render (done)
Selection of the vig wallet collection (done)
Final 3D prototype validated (done) 
Final prototype (planned)
Final 3D prototype printed (done)
2D render with dimensions and tolerances (planned)
Team of operators for assembling straps to the wallets (ourselves,done)
Plastic injections prices negotations (done,contracts and prices agreed) 
Mold Manufacturing leadtime (agreed and planned) 
Vig plastic injection process (planned)

Fulfilment
Shipping process defined (done)
Logistic procedure defined (done)
Study duty customs from Europe to U.S. (done)
Shipping company selected (done)
Selection of logistic company from Europe to U.S. (done, price, terms and conditions agreed)
Fulfilment company in U.S. (price, terms and conditions agreed)

Who are we?

The Vig wallet project started a year ago, when Silvia visited Barcelona and met Oscar through a mutual friend. Oscar was working on a new wallet concept and Silvia saw the potential of the idea. Silvia proposed they start a new project together, based on his wallet idea. Oscar accepted, of course! 

Next, Silvia set up the project principals and management milestones, while Oscar lead the design effort for the first Vig wallet. During the design phase work accumulated quickly, and two more people with specific professional skills joined to complete the Vig project team: Ernest Perera - Product Designer, and Rafa Castillo - Art Director.

The team has worked well together, with assistance from online tools, despite great distances between individuals. The team members are located: Silvia - U.S., Oscar and Ernest - Barcelona, and Rafa - Mexico D.F.

The diversity of the Vig team members made this project possible: Silvia runs her own fashion company, Le soleil de Miami. Oscar is a Computer Engineer with a solid background in software application development. Ernest is a Product Designer who also runs his own company, Amor de Madre. And Rafa Castillo is an Art Director who works at an advertising company. We found the best talent every place and from everyone!

Risks and challenges

The main challenge is making sure the Vig wallet mold is manufactured in time to meet production needs. We want to ensure we're able to take advantage of the cutting-edge plastics injection technology available now. 

Timing is everything. Delays could risk the project being completed months after our goal, which could push product release past the ideal time for best market exposure.

Questions and answers

1.-Exactly how can I organize my cards and banknotes in the VIG wallet?

There are many possibilities as described in the section "Overview" (last pictures).We have also just loaded a new photograph in the gallery to give you a clearer idea of what looks like...

Remember: the current picture shows a prototype; the final model will be much more sexy ;-)

2.-How do I order my VIG neck strap?

You just have to add the neck strap perk to your VIG wallet order.You will choose the color of the neck strap at the same time as the color of your VIG(s)... at the end of the campaign. 
Remember: only one necklace holder per VIG ordered and... DELIVERY IS FREE WORLDWIDE!

3.-Why is there a translucent model?

This is a very, very good question! After many months of design, we came with the idea that some of us may like to know the content of the wallet without having to open it. For example, you can see your driving licence through it, without having to open your VIG (which might prove helpful in the rain, snow, shower, etc...)

You will find additional shots of this model in the gallery.

References

Pedal Consumption  http://www.pedalconsumption.com/2013/12/vig-wallet/
Style She Spoke http://styleshespoke. 
Now Featured on Crowdfundfusion.com

bank notes total capacity will depend on the currency)

The
VIG is made of two components that are 100% recyclable:


Body:
	polypropylene resin, identification code nº5 

Band:
	elastic textile, sewed and stitched
Project StatusAfter 11 months of intense work, designing and testing Vig prototypes, we're satisfied that the design is complete. Now we're ready to begin production.All of our stakeholders have participated actively in the process. We designed Vig wallet by iterations, collecting feedback from users, and using that feedback to improve each prototype until we had it right. Lean Startup Methodology has been our principal guideline in this process. Pictured below there are the last prototype version:We will continue releasing new Vig color combinations. And these will be made available as we reach our financial goals.For the first run, we'll limit manufacturing to 5 models (Indiegogo Collection) from our Vig collection. This is a strategic decision to reduce risk of overextending our investment capital. If we exceed our funding goals, we will consider including more models of our collection in the first production run:We want the maximum benefit from the production phase and to, of course, achieve the best results. For this reason our proposal is to produce Vig wallets in Europe and U.S. This means the production costs will be slightly higher, but this arrangement will allow us better control of the production process and ease of intervention in case of production issues.We understand that people don't want to sacrifice quality for price, and price is a vital aspect of the product's success today's market. Users deserve products that are durable, functional and affordable. We want to meet these expectations and to do so we need two main things:  A minimum of 560 orders or 1195 wallets  The steel mold necessary for plastic injection (polypropylene)            The steel mold is the most expensive part of this investment and drives the bulk of our pledge request. Your investment will finance the production of the Vig wallet mold and plastic injection, to allow delivery of the finial product to our users.  
Production Plan
We have everything ready to start the production. We have compared different suppliers of industrial molds and plastic injectors. We  have also planned deadlines and following up meetings for the production. Communication process: we understand the importance of communication to our backers, we will provide continuous updates during the evolution of production. The production schedule is divided in 16 weeks , from receiving funds to final product shippment to our backers. Have a look below on our detailed activity plan:
Communication process (defined)Website (done)Social media (done)Supply chain Study different mold manufactures (done)Study different strap suppliers (done)Mold manufacturer supplier selection (done)Plastic injector selection (done,price,terms and conditions agreed)Mold manufacturer negotiations (done, guaranteed lead-time of 2 months, price,terms and conditions agreed) Straps selections (done) Packaging choice (in progress) Packaging print/wording selection (done) Packaging supply guaranteed (lead-time of 4 weeks) Manufacturing 3D render (done)Selection of the vig wallet collection (done)Final 3D prototype validated (done) Final prototype (planned)Final 3D prototype printed (done)2D render with dimensions and tolerances (planned)Team of operators for assembling straps to the wallets (ourselves,done)Plastic injections prices negotations (done,contracts and prices agreed) Mold Manufacturing leadtime (agreed and planned) Vig plastic injection process (planned)FulfilmentShipping process defined (done)Logistic procedure defined (done)Study duty customs from Europe to U.S. (done)Shipping company selected (done)Selection of logistic company from Europe to U.S. (done, price, terms and conditions agreed)Fulfilment company in U.S. (price, terms and conditions agreed)Who are we?The Vig wallet project started a year ago, when Silvia visited Barcelona and met Oscar through a mutual friend. Oscar was working on a new wallet concept and Silvia saw the potential of the idea. Silvia proposed they start a new project together, based on his wallet idea. Oscar accepted, of course! Next, Silvia set up the project principals and management milestones, while Oscar lead the design effort for the first Vig wallet. During the design phase work accumulated quickly, and two more people with specific professional skills joined to complete the Vig project team: Ernest Perera - Product Designer, and Rafa Castillo - Art Director.The team has worked well together, with assistance from online tools, despite great distances between individuals. The team members are located: Silvia - U.S., Oscar and Ernest - Barcelona, and Rafa - Mexico D.F.The diversity of the Vig team members made this project possible: Silvia runs her own fashion company, Le soleil de Miami. Oscar is a Computer Engineer with a solid background in software application development. Ernest is a Product Designer who also runs his own company, Amor de Madre. And Rafa Castillo is an Art Director who works at an advertising company. We found the best talent every place and from everyone!Risks and challengesThe main challenge is making sure the Vig wallet mold is manufactured in time to meet production needs. We want to ensure we're able to take advantage of the cutting-edge plastics injection technology available now. Timing is everything. Delays could risk the project being completed months after our goal, which could push product release past the ideal time for best market exposure.Questions and answers1.-Exactly how can I organize my cards and banknotes in the VIG wallet?There are many possibilities as described in the section "Overview" (last pictures).We have also just loaded a new photograph in the gallery to give you a clearer idea of what looks like...Remember: the current picture shows a prototype; the final model will be much more sexy ;-)2.-How do I order my VIG neck strap?You just have to add the neck strap perk to your VIG wallet order.You will choose the color of the neck strap at the same time as the color of your VIG(s)... at the end of the campaign. Remember: only one necklace holder per VIG ordered and... DELIVERY IS FREE WORLDWIDE!3.-Why is there a translucent model?This is a very, very good question! After many months of design, we came with the idea that some of us may like to know the content of the wallet without having to open it. For example, you can see your driving licence through it, without having to open your VIG (which might prove helpful in the rain, snow, shower, etc...)You will find additional shots of this model in the gallery.ReferencesPedal Consumption  http://www.pedalconsumption.com/2013/12/vig-wallet/

Style She Spoke http://styleshespoke. Now Featured on Crowdfundfusion.com

story:
Why We Need This Campaign ~

Volte Dancewear creates dance clothing. We are unique because we actually design the patterns of our fabrics.  Using state of the art technology and high fashion, Volte makes unique dance clothing in all sizes.

Volte Dancewear needs a dye sublimation printer and heat press to bring our designs and dreams to life.  Fabric printing machines range from $10,000 - $50,000 USD.  Our goal is to start with the least expensive model so that we can get production going!  

The cost of the two machines plus delivery and setup is $13,000.  This Indiegogo campaign is just for the equipment.  

We take our business very seriously. We feel that the people who fund our campaign want to see people happy and healthy.  

We have selected the "Fixed Funding" campaign.  The equipment cost comes to $13,000.00 USD. If we don't raise the full amount, we don't get any money.  

If you donate to our campaign and the goal is not reached, Indiegogo will refund your donation.

All Are Welcome ~

Michelle Obama, Ellen Degeneres, Richard Simmons...  They all say to get up and dance!  Dancing is such a wonderful form of expression and exercise. Yet many people are hesitant to take a dance class.  One reason is because there are very limited clothing options for people who may not have the "ideal" dancer body.  

Volte Dancewear was started to provide clothing options for people of all shapes and sizes!  We want dancers to feel comfortable, supported, beautiful, and accepted!

Most dance clothing that is currently available is only made to an XL (Most companies' XL size actually fits a size 10 woman!  This is below the average size of an American woman.)  Also, most dance clothing companies completely ignore people who are petite, tall, busty, hippy, etc.

Volte makes clothing from a size 0 to a size 30. We also create custom sizes for anyone who may need an extra inch here, or another ruffle there.

Why This Is Important ~

Body acceptance and anti-bullying are very important current social issues in America.  The dance world is an intense example of sizeism and discrimination.  There are few clothing options for people who have average to large size bodies.  The companies that make dancewear in these sizes typically only offer frumpy and unattractive outfits. Most dance fashion intentionally ignores people who are larger than a size 8, short, tall, or otherwise unique in body shape.  

We strongly feel that if people have access to fashionable, comfortable, and attractive dance clothing they will feel more welcome in the world of dance!

We also hope that as our brand grows and gains recognition, the world of dance will see the great potential to expand their businesses and accept dancers of all body types.

We Don't Just Want Your Money ~

Indiegogo also has some amazing share tools.  If you believe in Volte Dancewear's vision, please share our story with others via social media and word-of-mouth.  We need buzz to get this campaign going!  Even if you can't donate money, please take two minutes and share our campaign on Twitter, Facebook, etc...

Thank you!!!

story:
A new category of sustainable, cross-occasion shoes.  Dress them up, dress them down. They’re incredibly versatile. And unlike other shoes, you don't have to sacrifice style for comfort (or vice-versa).  Plus, they’re made of upcycled plastic, so you’ll be helping out the planet with each step.

 

 

 

It all started at a campground wedding.  A group of guys was complaining about the discomfort of their formal shoes.  This sparked the question, aren’t there guys shoes that look AND feel good?

When we looked, we found sandals or sneakers at one end of the market - and formal shoes on the other.  There wasn’t much in between and nothing that crossed occasions well.  So we created a mash-up... a super comfortable, versatile and design forward loafer with the environment in mind.

 

 

 

We think walking tall means paying attention to our footprint, so we upcycle plastic to make our shoes.  Every year over 8MM metric tons of plastic enter the world’s oceans. A Blue Flag is the international designation for a pristine beach, and we’re committed to seeing more Blue Flags fly.  Each pair of Blue Flag shoes is made with ~8 discarded water bottles.

story:
We're a Swimwear Company With Soul!

Hey! Im Sara, surf enthusiast and nature lover. I'm super passionate about what we're trying to achieve with PARC and I know you will be too. 

I want to be able to get out on the water and not feel self conscious. I want grab my long board and go have fun. And I want everyone to feel the same way!

Looking at all these images of super tanned ladies with one body type in every single image can get depressing. I've talked with so many women who don't want to get out on the water solely because of how they feel in a bathing suit. I know how amazing being active and being on the water makes me feel and I want that for every one. You shouldn't feel that you can't do something because of the way that main stream media has portrayed women in that sport.

I want all women to feel confident to get out there so I wanted to create swimwear that makes you love how you feel so you can do what you love! 

But we can't make this happen without your help. Please share and/or pledge to our campaign and help us make a difference.

- Sara 


What's Unique About A PARC Suit?

  • Our designs are all based off the needs for active women with different shapes. There is a style to accommodate different bust sizes, bum coverages and different activities. 
  • Our swimwear is made with a high-quality, soft, supportive and quick dry fabric. Think along the lines of a silky soft really light neoprene. No saggy bums here!


The Impact

We're not just about bikini's:

    • You are helping us to make a positive impact on the industry and in the lives of young women. We feature the real women and positive role models who wear our suits. These women come in all shapes and sizes and we want to promote a positive body image no matter your shape.
    • We want to keep our footprint as minimal as possible which is why we design in Vancouver and manufacture in the USA. 
    • We donate 10% of profits to organizations that encourage young women to get active and build confidence. The money goes to creating scholarships for these programs for girls who don't have the financial means to attend.


What We Need:

  • We need enough capital in order to run production with our manufacturer and create inventory. 
  • All funds will go towards purchasing bulk orders of fabric and production costs. 


How You Can Help:

  • By supporting us on this Indiegogo campaign by pledging one of the options below. 
  • By sharing us to all your friends and family through the Indiegogo share links. We want to get the word out about our amazing swimwear and initiatives and we need your help!
  • Share, follow and like us on social media: @parcswimwear


What You Get:

Perk $5: A virtual high-five for being awesome and helping us to reach our goal!


Perk $20: Cotton PARC Beach Tote

  • two-tone black and natural cotton parc logo beach tote


Perk $30: Women's Tank In Three Options

  • Our "Wild Flower" tank in tri-blend white, Our "Wild Calls" tank in tri-blend black or our "Affirmation" tank in tri-blend black. 
  • Women's tri-blend racer back tank American Apparel - Made in the USA


Perk $35: PARC Merino Wool Toque 

  • Black or Light Grey Option
  • Made in the USA


Perk $40: Women's Tee In Three Options 

  • Our "Wild Flower" tee in white, our "Wild Calls" tee in black or our "Affirmation" tee in black. 
  • Super soft and flowy fabric
  • Women's Ultra Wash American Apparel - Made in the USA


Perk $45: PARC 5 Panel Hat In Two Options

  • 5 panel hat in denim/suede or wool/suede
  • Made in the USA


  • "The Wild Calls" Triangle or "Affirmation" Post options 
  • Hand-Made in Tofino, B.C. exclusively for PARC


Perk $65: PARC Short Sleeve Terry Kangaroo Sweater

  • printed on american apparel. Made in the USA. 
  • perfect to throw on post-surf or paddle


Perk $115: PARC Bikini Bottom

  • 3 styles: "COVE" - high waisted, "COASTAL" - medium coverage and "CHARGER" - cheeky coverage
  • 4 color options: black, blue, stripe or floral 
  • Our swimwear is made with a high-quality, soft, supportive and quick dry fabric. 
  • Designed in Vancouver and made in San Francisco
  • Size M top and bottom shown on both girls

Pictured above: waist 25", bust 32 D, height 5'2"

 Pictured above: hip 30", bust 32 C, height 5'11"

 Pictured above: hip 30", bust 32 D, height 5'2"


Perk $125: PARC Bikini Top

  • 4 styles: "PACIFICA" - high neck, "SOMBRIO" - V front and racer style back, "SWELL" - straight strap back and "PEAK" - criss cross back. 
  • 4 color options: black, blue, stripe or floral 
  • Our swimwear is made with a high-quality, soft, supportive and quick dry fabric
  •  Designed in Vancouver and made in San Francisco
  • Size M top and bottom shown on both girls

 Pictured above: waist 25", bust 32 D, height 5'2"

 Pictured above: hip 30", bust 32 C, height 5'11"

 Pictured above: hip 30", bust 32 D, height 5'2"

 Pictured above: hip 30", bust 32 C, height 5'11"


Perk $240: PARC Bikini Top and Bottom

  • Your choice of one of 4 bikini tops and one of 3 bikini bottom styles. 
  • You can mix and match any style, color options and sizing.
  •  4 color options: black, blue, stripe or floral 
  •  Our swimwear is made with a high-quality, soft, supportive and quick dry fabric
  •  Designed in Vancouver and made in San Francisco
  • Size M top and bottom shown on both girls

 Pictured above: waist 25", bust 32 D, height 5'2"

Pictured above: hip 30", bust 32 C, height 5'11"

SWELL Top X CHARGER Bottoms

 Pictured above: waist 25", bust 32 D, height 5'2"

PEAK Top x COASTAL Bottom
Pictured above: hip 30", bust 32 C, height 5'11"

Perk $350: Any Set + One More Piece 

  • You get to choose one top, one bottom and then either another top or bottom.
  • You can mix and match any style, color and size of the pieces 
  • 4 color options: black, blue, stripe and floral
  • For all your matching and styling needs!


Perk $450: A set of your choice now + first dibs on a set (any styles) for next run’s prints

  • This option gets you any mix and match style, color and size of a top and bottom from our current line and then a top and bottom of your choice for next year's new prints/colors. 


Perk $800: Swimwear Subscription

  •  A set of your choice now + receive a new suit (in your choice of style and print each season for the next 3 years) and we’ll ship for free for the 3 future suits


Perk $2,000: Collab with PARC! 

  • A suit set now and collaborate with us on a print or color for our next run. You think it up and we work together to bring it to life.
  • You will also get two sets (2 tops and 2 bottoms) from our collab run
  • *Please note the design process has to be approved on both ends before we will go ahead with production. Please contact us if you have any questions. 



Risks & Challenges:

A potential risk and challenge with our project is production timing. Right now our time line is based on our successful crowd fund amount, plus a bit more, but if we were to have a much larger then expected response this could effect how fast we are able to produce all that swimwear and apparel. We are hoping to mitigate this potential challenge by letting our factory know in advance and also to keep all of our crowd funders up to date on progress.

story:
KILLWOOD BIKA

You love your bike, and care for the environment. Why not show it off?

 

Bika is an elegant, simple, multi-functional bike rack that proudly showcases your prized chariot, provides room for your gear, and keeps your keys at the ready. It's the only premium bike rack that features beautifully blue, CO2-offsetting pine beetle kill wood. 

Whether you're a weekend biker, a hardcore cyclist, or a fixed gear fanatic, you'll love Bika's blend of sustainability and contemporary design.  

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

___________________________

 

KILLWOOD BOTTO

Elegant, sustainable, functional. The perfect patio companion.

 

Botto is a magnetic bottle opener lovingly handcrafted from beautifully blue pine beetle kill wood. A rare-earth magnet catches the bottle cap so you don't have to fumble between barstool legs to pick them up. Botto is beautifully finished with natural and food-safe top oil, and rust free stainless steel hardware. Made in Vancouver BC, Canada.

 

 

 

 

___________________________

 

The Pine Beetle Epidemic

 

Pine beetle affected trees release immense amounts of CO2, so much that it equals to 3.7 million cars on the road per year. If these trees are not used, they will even emit methane gas.

 

 

 

Pine Beetle Kill Wood

 

The pine beetle also creates a bold blue color in the kill wood, yet the structural strength remains the same as conventional lumber. By choosing pine beetle kill wood products like Bika, you are mitigating pollution, reducing the risk of wildfires, strengthening the economy, and revitalizing our beautiful forests.
story_txt: KILLWOOD BIKAYou love your bike, and care for the environment. Why not show it off? Bika is an elegant, simple, multi-functional bike rack that proudly showcases your prized chariot, provides room for your gear, and keeps your keys at the ready. It's the only premium bike rack that features beautifully blue, CO2-offsetting pine beetle kill wood. Whether you're a weekend biker, a hardcore cyclist, or a fixed gear fanatic, you'll love Bika's blend of sustainability and contemporary design.         ___________________________ KILLWOOD BOTTOElegant, sustainable, functional. The perfect patio companion. Botto is a magnetic bottle opener lovingly handcrafted from beautifully blue pine beetle kill wood. A rare-earth magnet catches the bottle cap so you don't have to fumble between barstool legs to pick them up. Botto is beautifully finished with natural and food-safe top oil, and rust free stainless steel hardware. Made in Vancouver BC, Canada.    ___________________________ The Pine Beetle Epidemic Pine beetle affected trees release immense amounts of CO2, so much that it equals to 3.7 million cars on the road per year. If these trees are not used, they will even emit methane gas.   Pine Beetle Kill Wood The pine beetle also creates a bold blue color in the kill wood, yet the structural strength remains the same as conventional lumber. By choosing pine beetle kill wood products like Bika, you are mitigating pollution, reducing the risk of wildfires, strengthening the economy, and revitalizing our beautiful forests.

story:
Printkosten

Ik wil graag 8 unieke wenskaarten in druk laten gaan die ik ontworpen heb (zie gallery ^^).
Om de kaartjes tegen een schappelijke prijs te kunnen verkopen, 8 voor €15 euro (1,85€ per kaartje) druk ik ze het best op een grote oplage, wat een grote investeringskost inhoudt.

Wat is de kwaliteit en het type van de kaarten?

  • 300 grams, milieuvriendelijk houtloos karton
  • A6 X 2, dus dubbelgevouwen kwaliteitskaarten
  • Full colour
  • Gratis enveloppen erbij

Wat heb ik nodig?

Het drukken kost ongeveer 1500€ voor 8 X 1000 exemplaren.
Ik kan zelf 500 euro inbrengen en ik zou graag de overige 1000 verzamelen via indiegogo.

Wat kan je doen en wat krijg je ervoor?

Ik zou graag donaties verzamelen van 10 euro, waarvoor je 8 kaartjes gratis krijgt toegestuurd + enveloppes.
Je spaart zo 33% (5 €) uit, later kosten ze 15€.

Risico?

Nope, als ik het budget van 1000€ niet haal, krijgt iedereen gewoon zijn geld terug.
Als ik het wel haal, laat ik ze drukken en krijg je de kaartjes opgestuurd.

story:
Athletica V - Vegan Athletic Apparel

100% Performance, 0% Cruelty - Always

Athletica V was founded with the simple mission of providing high performance, 100% vegan athletic apparel that not only avoid animal products but also the animal supply chain. Here's a little more about us:

•At Athletica V, we design and manufacture athletic apparel, only using cruelty free materials (fabrics, inks, dyes, etc) to create the most vegan athletic apparel on the market. We also exclusively source domestic materials and labor, keeping our footprint small and controllable.

•Everything we use is investigated and validated to make sure it adheres to a cruelty-free lifestyle. We ask all of our suppliers to confirm that the materials we are buying are animal product/byproduct free. If they can't answer that question (or can't answer 'yes' to that question), we don't buy from them. 

•What we've created is an apparel company that is about as far from the animal supply chain as possible. At Athletica V, we don't offer a few vegan options. Rather, we ONLY have vegan options. Bottom line, we're invested in making garments that are as ethical as you are.

Help us get these new tops created! We've had a dream of revolutionizing the athletic apparel market, making amazing clothing that is as cruelty-free as it gets, sourced exclusively from the United States and made by American workers. It can happen - but not without your help!

This is the first step to achieving that dream. By helping us launch this line, you're not only supporting us, but you're supporting vegan athletics in general, casting an affirmative vote that vegans want an active wear clothing line tailored just for them. Getting us to our goal, you'll also help us design and manufacture more items and deepen our portfolio. 

How is Vegan Athletic Apparel Different?

This is what makes us different from all of the other players on the market (see the difference here):

  • 100% Vegan
  • No Animal Products or Animal By-Products - Ever
  • Work With Suppliers to Ensure Materials Are Free From Animal Products
  • Only Use 100% Vegan Inks
  • Always Seek Out the Vegan Option/Supplier - Even If They Cost More
  • Founded, Owned and Staffed By Vegans

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for $15,000.00 for this campaign. After doing our nerdy number crunching stuff, we concluded that this amount will allow us to do two things:

  1. It will allow us to launch a men's and women's line of tee shirts and tank tops - made in the USA from cruelty-free, stretch cotton.
  2. We will also be able to research and develop a fall collection of long sleeve tops and fleece jackets. By funding us today, you're investing in helping us now and also in the future.

Perk #1 - Web Shout Out


Perk #2 - Men's Tank (for more info please see our website)

Perk #3 - Women's Tank (for more info please see our website)


Perk #4 - Men's Tee Shirt


Perk #5 - Women's Tee Shirt

By backing us, you can get your very own Athletica V stretch cotton tee shirt or stretch cotton tank top (or both) to veganize your workout apparel. In addition to all of the good karma, thanks and heartfelt gratitude that we’ll send your way for funding us, you'll add some fantastic cruelty-free items to your wardrobe.

As if it can’t get any better, we’re also rewarding the early adopters who are believing in us now, rather than after we become some huge break-out hit! We’re offering our tees and tanks at below retail pricing (and with free domestic shipping too) for all of you who want to be a part of the first wave of Athletica V nation.

What's the Big Deal About Vegan Athletic Apparel?

To us, what you put on your body is just as important as what you put in it. Veganism isn’t a diet - it’s a lifestyle choice. And it’s about making the best choices you can to walk away from animal cruelty. What Athletica V offers is clothing without compromise. We don't ask you to give us your dollars in spite of the animal products we may use in other parts of our company. We make sure that everything we do at this company is aligned with a vegan lifestyle. ’Nuff said.

You see, when we got started, our first thoughts weren’t profits and scale and margins - rather it was changing the world, bringing a product to market that felt right, that aligned with our ethics (and yours) and removed compromise from the equation - whether you were vegan or just wanted to get a shirt that wasn’t off-shored halfway around the world.

If this is something you believe in as well, or something you want to see in a clothing company, then welcome to Athletica V, nice to have you on board!

Want to learn more about us, check us out here.

Why We Need Your Help

Making 100% vegan garments exclusively in the USA isn’t easy. We’ll tell you that up front. The amount of time, energy and effort that we've put forward to design and make vegan workout apparel is huge. Being a small start up, there are a ton of hurdles that can trip us up. But not if we have the best thing a small company can have on its side: Demand!

That's where you come in. With your help we will be able to get over those hurdles and nothing will keep us from bringing you some amazing apparel!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re not ready for a vegan tee shirt or tank top, or if your closet is too full, you can still help us out:

•Share this campaign with others. Send this to all of the vegan/vegetarian/ethical consumers that you know. Help us spread the word and get people interested. As a very small army at Athletica V, we always appreciate the assistance that anyone can give us by sharing our story with others, pointing people to our website (or this campaign) or following us on Twitter

story:
Smarter, More Affordable More Powerful
Meet this most exciting smart watch.

For Sports

Mic.watch came to Indiegogo with Qualcomm 3100 and Android 9.0 systems to improve motion detection. Because Mic.watch-one has advanced motion detection, you can set your own sports goals at any time and improve your exercise intensity.

 

 

For Sleep

Mic.watch-one uses improved sleep detection technology and a built-in smart heart rate monitor to detect your sleep status whenever and wherever you want.

For your style

Mic.watch-one is equipped with ip6-7 waterproof, sapphire glass and leather, stainless steel strap and quick release butterfly clasp.

For happiness

In addition to professional sports functions, it also has music control functions. Control music with pairing with your phone via Bluetooth. You can also connect the stereo and car Bluetooth directly by downloading the app.

For a convenient life

Mic.watch-one can install a stand-alone app, or connect to the phone via Bluetooth, read the reply message at any time, make a call, get the weather travel status in time, and map navigation.

For Love For Health

Choose a Mic.watch-one smart watch for your loved ones, and keep an eye on their health with the best hardware.

Comparison Chart

Production Packaging

Smart watch detection

TEAM

Mic.watch is based in ChengDu and founded in 2016. We are always committed to designing and producing products that meet the requirements of our customers and are popular among the public, allowing our backers to have fun with their tablets in a new way. Have created our 'Dream team' of passionate and skilled engineers and designers.Our team has over 7 years' experience in electronic product design and manufacturing. We all share a common passion for what we do. After our success with our previous products , we have greatly improved and evolved our concepts and processes. We are excited to use Indiegogo as the launch pad for our best product yet – Mic.Watch.

The reason we are launching the Mic.watch-one on Indiegogo, is mainly due to the cost of development and research as well as components procurement. By crowdfunding, we can make better products with the confidence that we can deliver on time. We really need your help to Make it a reality - plus, we solemnly promise that all funds raised by the Mic.watch campaign will be used for product development and production.
Please, do not hesitate to contact us at  microfaceone@gmial.com. We are looking forward to answering any of your questions.

story:
Hi, thank you for checking out my campaign :)

You may know me, Sahasa, from Instagram (@sahasa.artist) where I have regularly been posting my art since Summer 2016, much of it being in the form of miniature koi ponds (handsculpted polymer clay koi encased in resin.)

The ponds aren't the most accessible type of creation, and I have been wondering what I could do about this... To bring my work to many of you in an affordable way:

Solution: design a koi enamel pin!

The designing part is over, I sketched & scribbled and then created a nice clean design from the drafts by using the pen tool in Photoshop. See what I came up with below, a lovely Tancho Showa koi. A white koi with a red spot on the head and black markings on the body and fins. The idea is to use gold plating on this pin and a rubber clutch on the back.

Now, this pin still needs to be manufactured. To ensure high quality I found a trusted company that can produce the pins... but I need your help to fund this project! I would love to make this wearable, and collectable piece of art and durable 40 mm koi pin a reality.

Where does the money go?

  • Funding to manufacture the pins
  • Funding for packaging
  • Shipping the pins to you

What do You get?

  • A unique,  collectable / wearable, 40mm hard enamel koi pin designed by me! With different koi designs to follow, should this campaign be successful, so you can grow your collection of super cool koi pins ;)
  • The fuzzy feeling of supporting an independent artist.
 

Risk

  • There's very little risk for this campaign. The company I selected for producing this pin is trusted and reliable. They have verified the design can be made. It's possible some minor design changes may occur.
  • It's a fixed funding campaign, if the goal is not reached you are refunded. There's no risk of losing your money and getting no product. But the fixed funding also means, if you really like this pin and want it to be made: spread the word! Because I can't produce it unless the goal is reached!

 

The Waiting Game

Be aware the campaign will run for 30 days. A good thing to keep in mind is the production time of the pin, which at this moment, I have been told by the company would be 4 to 6 weeks. This may be different when I place the order. I will be ordering after the campaign ends and funding has been cleared etc.

When I receive the pins from the production company, I will check every single one, package them by hand and then ship them out to you. Depending from where you are in the world this may take another 1 to 2 weeks.

This project is not about an instant creation. It will take some time.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute or aren't interested in this pin design but still want to help. Or if you plan on contributing but want to do more (yay!):

  • Please spread the word on your choice of Social Media! It takes just a few seconds and it means the world to me, I would appreciate this very much :D
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools for extra ease or repost from my Instagram: @sahasa.artist
  • Remember it needs to reach the goal to be able to produce this pin.

Thank you so much for taking the time to view this campaign!
